wikipedia_page.main: Myrtle Sharon Mary Augee (born 4 February 1965 in Greenwich, Greater London) is a female retired English shot putter.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1988 Summer Olympics

response: In the shot put her personal best was , achieved in May 1983 in Tucson. This is the current NCAA Division 1 Outdoor Track and Field record as well as the Scottish national record, and places her third on the British outdoor list, behind Judy Oakes and Myrtle Augee.

Her personal best put was 17.53 metres, achieved in July 1980 in the Moscow 1980 Summer Olympics. This places her fifth on the British outdoor all-time list, behind Judy Oakes, Myrtle Augee, Meg Ritchie and Venissa Head. It was the British record at the time.UK All-Time Lists: Women - Throws - GBR Athletics She represented England in the shot put event, at the 1978 Commonwealth Games in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. Four years later she represented England again in the shot put event, at the 1982 Commonwealth Games in Brisbane, Queensland, Australia.

Her personal best put was 17.45 metres, achieved in July 1989 in London (Crystal Palace). This places her sixth on the British outdoor all-time list, behind Judy Oakes, Myrtle Augee, Meg Ritchie, Venissa Head and Angela Littlewood.UK All-Time Lists: Women - Throws - GBR Athletics

Her personal best put is 17.13 metres, achieved in August 2006 in Crawley. This places her seventh on the British outdoor all-time list, behind Judy Oakes, Myrtle Augee, Meg Ritchie, Venissa Head, Angela Littlewood and Yvonne Hanson-Nortey.UK All-Time Lists: Women - Throws - GBR Athletics
* Myrtle Augee, Senior Officer, HM Prison Pentonville, London, Ministry of Justice.
